text: Answer: 0.1 Solution: Given that: Tp = 50 ms So RTT =2 * 50 ms = 100 ms The optimal window size in TCP = Bandwidth delay product is a measurement of how many bits can fill up a network link. It gives the maximum amount of data that can be transmitted by the sender at a given time before waiting for acknowledgment. So, bandwidth delay product = 100 * 10 sec * 8 * 105 bps = 0.1 MB
